metadata.name: WIRE
metadata.description:
FREQX - NEBRASKA

The series merges photography taken on a trip to Nebraska in 2006 for my Grandmother's funeral and a bespoke 3D sculpture of a human FREQX bust icon. 

Representing human existence, the hovering icon transforms banal landscapes and picturesque working-class scenery into surreal dreamlike imagery.

As warped reflections of the surrounding landscapes caress the mirrored human obelisk, a relationship is created between the bodies.

From the obelisk's perspective, this process may be viewed as the human ideal—power over nature through technology and intelligence. However, the forms’ visual presence of existence is only revealed by the influence of the landscape over the form.

This symbiotic relationship exposes the idea of memory, captured information as an input source that creates existence.
